intro: Knautia eburnea, commonly known as the silver knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters, making it a popular choice for garden borders and wildflower gardens. Knautia eburnea is well-suited to full sun and well-drained soil, thriving in temperate climates.
